Convert offset string: "[+/-]HHMM" or offset value in hours: +16, -5.5, to timezone abbreviation strings

Matched locations can be filtered by country name, city name or region code

timezone.to_abbr(input, country_or_city = NULL)

Examples

# Using offset value
timezone.to_abbr(+8)
#>  [1] "+08"   "AWST"  "BNT"   "CST"   "HKT"   "WIB"   "WITA"  "ULAT"  "HOVST"
#> [10] "CHOT"  "MOT"   "MYT"   "BORT"  "PHT"   "SGT"   "TLT"   "JWST"  "IDT"  
#> 

# If filtered by region code
timezone.to_abbr(+8, country_or_city = "HK")
#> [1] "HKT"
#> 

# If filtered by country name
timezone.to_abbr(+8, country_or_city = "Vietnam")
#> [1] "IDT"
#> 

# If filtered by city name
timezone.to_abbr(+8, country_or_city = "Shanghai")
#> [1] "CST"
#> 

# Using offset string
timezone.to_abbr("-0500")
#>  [1] "ACT"   "EST"   "CDT"   "CWT"   "CPT"   "MDDT"  "CLT"   "EASST" "COT"  
#> [10] "CST"   "ECT"   "PET"  
#> 

# If filtered by region code
timezone.to_abbr("-0500", country_or_city = "US")
#> [1] "EST" "CDT" "CWT" "CPT"
#>
